title: 'A great step': Australia's House of Representatives passes bill to ban children under 16 from social media
content: Australia's House of Representatives passed a bill banning children under 16 from social media. Platforms like TikTok and Facebook could face hefty fines for non-compliance. While facing criticism regarding privacy and parental control, the bill aims to protect children online and is expected to pass the Senate. Supporters believe it's a crucial step in ensuring children's online safety.
summary: Australia's House of Representatives passed a bill banning children under 16 from social media.  Platforms like TikTok and Facebook could face hefty fines for non-compliance.  While facing criticism regarding privacy and parental control, the bill aims to protect children online and is expected to pass the Senate.  Supporters believe it's a crucial step in ensuring children's online safety.

title: Special Counsel Jack Smith's investigation into Trump costs taxpayers over $50 million: Report
content: Special Counsel Jack Smith's investigation into former President Donald Trump has incurred costs nearing $50 million. The investigation focused on Trump's handling of classified documents and attempts to overturn the 2020 election. However, Trump's 2024 election victory paused the legal proceedings due to Justice Department rules.
summary: Special Counsel Jack Smith's investigation into former President Donald Trump has incurred costs nearing $50 million. The investigation focused on Trump's handling of classified documents and attempts to overturn the 2020 election. However, Trump's 2024 election victory paused the legal proceedings due to Justice Department rules.

title: Israel and Hezbollah reach ceasefire deal for Lebanon: What are the terms of agreement?
content: Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a ceasefire in Lebanon. Israeli troops and Hezbollah will withdraw. UN peacekeepers will deploy. The US will lead an international monitoring group. The Gaza conflict is not part of this agreement. Hezbollah's support depends on Israel halting attacks.
summary: Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a ceasefire in Lebanon.  Israeli troops and Hezbollah will withdraw.  UN peacekeepers will deploy.  The US will lead an international monitoring group.  The Gaza conflict is not part of this agreement.  Hezbollah's support depends on Israel halting attacks.

title: Kamala Harris' Team: 'Price paid' for short campaign against Donald Trump
content: Kamala Harris's campaign leadership attributed their loss to Donald Trump primarily to the short 107-day campaign period following Biden's withdrawal. They defended their strategic choices on "Pod Save America," including their approach to Republican voters and the decision not to counter Trump's attack on Harris's stance on transgender inmate surgeries, despite acknowledging its effectiveness.
summary: Kamala Harris's campaign leadership attributed their loss to Donald Trump primarily to the short 107-day campaign period following Biden's withdrawal.  They defended their strategic choices on "Pod Save America," including their approach to Republican voters and the decision not to counter Trump's attack on Harris's stance on transgender inmate surgeries, despite acknowledging its effectiveness.

title: FBI agent uses free tattoo, modeling promise to lure, sexually assault victims, says police
content: An FBI agent, Eduardo Valdivia, using aliases, has been accused of sexually assaulting two women in Maryland. He allegedly lured them via Instagram with promises of tattoos and modeling work, then assaulted them during photo shoots. Valdivia's lawyer claims the interactions were consensual.
summary: An FBI agent, Eduardo Valdivia, using aliases, has been accused of sexually assaulting two women in Maryland. He allegedly lured them via Instagram with promises of tattoos and modeling work, then assaulted them during photo shoots. Valdivia's lawyer claims the interactions were consensual.

title: US' largest trade partners Mexico, Canada and China respond to Trump's tariff threat
content: President-elect Trump has announced plans to impose tariffs on goods from Mexico, Canada, and China, citing concerns over fentanyl, illegal drugs, and migration. The move has drawn sharp criticism from all three countries, with leaders warning of economic damage and retaliatory measures.
summary: President-elect Trump has announced plans to impose tariffs on goods from Mexico, Canada, and China, citing concerns over fentanyl, illegal drugs, and migration. The move has drawn sharp criticism from all three countries, with leaders warning of economic damage and retaliatory measures.

title: Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire: What it means for Lebanonâ€™s future
content: A US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah is set to begin, halting over a year of fighting. The deal involves Israeli troop withdrawals and Hezbollah's retreat north of the Litani River, with UN peacekeepers deployed. While offering a reprieve, the agreement's fragility is underscored by the unresolved Gaza conflict and the broader Palestinian question.
summary: A US-brokered ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah is set to begin, halting over a year of fighting.  The deal involves Israeli troop withdrawals and Hezbollah's retreat north of the Litani River, with UN peacekeepers deployed. While offering a reprieve, the agreement's fragility is underscored by the unresolved Gaza conflict and the broader Palestinian question.

title: Submerged car, human remains found in Georgia pond may solve 1980 New York couple disappearance
content: A submerged car found in a Georgia pond may solve the 44-year-old mystery of a missing New York couple. The vehicle matches the description of the car belonging to Charles and Catherine Romer, who disappeared in 1980. Personal belongings and a human bone were discovered inside, offering potential closure to their family.
summary: A submerged car found in a Georgia pond may solve the 44-year-old mystery of a missing New York couple. The vehicle matches the description of the car belonging to Charles and Catherine Romer, who disappeared in 1980. Personal belongings and a human bone were discovered inside, offering potential closure to their family.

title: US: Uber Eats burrito delivery turns out to be marijuana
content: An Uber Eats driver in New Jersey smelled something unusual during a delivery. She called the police. The package contained marijuana disguised as a burrito. Police are investigating the incident. The drugs were seized. Uber praised the driver's actions. This follows a similar incident involving fraudulent gift cards.
summary: An Uber Eats driver in New Jersey smelled something unusual during a delivery.  She called the police. The package contained marijuana disguised as a burrito.  Police are investigating the incident. The drugs were seized.  Uber praised the driver's actions.  This follows a similar incident involving fraudulent gift cards.

title: Scientists find new formula that could help detect killer asteroids
content: Spanish scientists have developed a groundbreaking formula using the gravitational bending of light to pinpoint celestial objects, including potentially dangerous asteroids. This enhances asteroid orbit prediction and planetary defence systems like Nasa's DART.
summary: Spanish scientists have developed a groundbreaking formula using the gravitational bending of light to pinpoint celestial objects, including potentially dangerous asteroids. This enhances asteroid orbit prediction and planetary defence systems like Nasa's DART.

title: Texas offers land for Trump deportation centres, names initiative after slain girl Jocelyn Nungaray
content: Texas proposed land for deportation centers, named "Jocelyn Initiative," after a girl allegedly killed by illegal immigrants. The initiative aims to expedite deportations of violent criminal migrants upon Trump's potential return to office. Texas offered land and resources, with Trump's team confirming their intent to utilize them, potentially with military assistance.
summary: Texas proposed land for deportation centers, named "Jocelyn Initiative," after a girl allegedly killed by illegal immigrants. The initiative aims to expedite deportations of violent criminal migrants upon Trump's potential return to office. Texas offered land and resources, with Trump's team confirming their intent to utilize them, potentially with military assistance.

title: Did Kamala Harris campaign blame Biden for election loss? 'Price to be paid for...'
content: Kamala Harris' campaign chair, Jen O'Malley Dillon, in her first interview since the election defeat said it was a bulls**t notion that Harris was scared of interviews. The Harris campaign said the election result was the price to be paid for their shortened campaign, indirectly holding Joe Biden responsible for the defeat. The campaign didn't acknowledge any mistake on their part and said they just had less time.
summary: Kamala Harris' campaign chair, Jen O'Malley Dillon, in her first interview since the election defeat said it was a bulls**t  notion that Harris was scared of interviews. The Harris campaign said the election result was the price to be paid for their shortened campaign, indirectly holding Joe Biden responsible for the defeat. The campaign didn't acknowledge any mistake on their part and said they just had less time.

title: Fugitive on FBIâ€™s most wanted list arrested in Wales after two decades
content: Daniel Andreas San Diego, a fugitive wanted for two 2003 California bombings linked to animal rights extremism, has been arrested in Wales after 20 years on the run. The FBI, who had placed him on their Most Wanted Terrorists list, confirmed his capture and praised the collaborative efforts leading to his arrest. Extradition proceedings have begun.
summary: Daniel Andreas San Diego, a fugitive wanted for two 2003 California bombings linked to animal rights extremism, has been arrested in Wales after 20 years on the run.  The FBI, who had placed him on their Most Wanted Terrorists list, confirmed his capture and praised the collaborative efforts leading to his arrest. Extradition proceedings have begun.

title: Prince Harryâ€™s return to UK in question as Meghan Markle â€˜never really felt at homeâ€™, claims book
content: Prince Harry's UK return remains uncertain as Meghan Markle reportedly has no desire to ever step foot in England again, feeling she never belonged. While Harry has visited since their 2020 royal exit, including a recent trip after King Charles's cancer diagnosis, Meghan hasn't accompanied him.
summary: Prince Harry's UK return remains uncertain as Meghan Markle reportedly has no desire to ever step foot in England again, feeling she never belonged. While Harry has visited since their 2020 royal exit, including a recent trip after King Charles's cancer diagnosis, Meghan hasn't accompanied him.

title: Trudeau says he had a 'good call' with Trump after tax threat: 'This is a relationship that...'

This is something that we can do -- laying out the facts, and looking forward in constructive ways. This is a relationship that we know takes a certain amount of working on and that's what we will do," Trudeau said.

title: Netanyahu pushes ceasefire plan to end 14-month conflict with Hezbollah, vows 'We will attack with might if breached'
content: A US-brokered ceasefire deal between Israel and Hezbollah offers a glimmer of hope after 14 months of conflict. The agreement proposes a two-month halt to hostilities, with Hezbollah withdrawing north of the Litani River and Israel returning troops to its border. Despite Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's endorsement and President Biden's optimism, intense clashes continued, raising concerns about implementation.
summary: A US-brokered ceasefire deal between Israel and Hezbollah offers a glimmer of hope after 14 months of conflict. The agreement proposes a two-month halt to hostilities, with Hezbollah withdrawing north of the Litani River and Israel returning troops to its border. Despite Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's endorsement and President Biden's optimism, intense clashes continued, raising concerns about implementation.

title: Mexican president warns 'tariff against tariff' to Donald Trump's 25% import duties threat
content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum warned of retaliatory tariffs against President-elect Donald Trump's proposed 25% import duties. Trump announced the tariffs on Mexico and Canada, aiming to curb migration and drug trafficking. Sheinbaum argued the tariffs would be ineffective, causing inflation and job loss, solving nothing. Mexico did a lot to stem the flow of migrants, the president said adding that Mexico suffers from an influx of weapons smuggled in from the United States.
summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum warned of retaliatory tariffs against President-elect Donald Trump's proposed 25% import duties. Trump announced the tariffs on Mexico and Canada, aiming to curb migration and drug trafficking.  Sheinbaum argued the tariffs would be ineffective, causing inflation and job loss, solving nothing.  Mexico did a lot to stem the flow of migrants, the president said adding that Mexico suffers from an influx of weapons smuggled in from the United States.

title: Trump aide who clashed with Elon Musk at dinner table is under investigation because...
content: Donald Trump's top adviser, Boris Epshteyn, faces investigation over allegations of soliciting money from potential nominees for lobbying efforts. In February, Epshteyn reportedly asked Scott Bessent, a treasury secretary nominee, for a $30,000 monthly fee. Eric Trump stated that Epshteyn would face repercussions if the allegations prove true, emphasizing that such behavior is unacceptable.
summary: Donald Trump's top adviser, Boris Epshteyn, faces investigation over allegations of soliciting money from potential nominees for lobbying efforts. In February, Epshteyn reportedly asked Scott Bessent, a treasury secretary nominee, for a $30,000 monthly fee. Eric Trump stated that Epshteyn would face repercussions if the allegations prove true, emphasizing that such behavior is unacceptable.

title: Watch: Cook County official Samantha Steele rolls eyes as she gets arrested for DUI after crash
content: Cook County Commissioner Samantha Steele faces DUI charges after a November 10 car crash in Chicago. Bodycam footage reveals her confrontational behavior, including invoking her official status and making inappropriate remarks to officers. Steele refused sobriety tests and an open wine bottle was found in her car.
summary: Cook County Commissioner Samantha Steele faces DUI charges after a November 10 car crash in Chicago. Bodycam footage reveals her confrontational behavior, including invoking her official status and making inappropriate remarks to officers. Steele refused sobriety tests and an open wine bottle was found in her car.

title: Donald Trump's approval rating soars, Biden's four-year low; JD Vance top choice for 2028
content: President-elect Donald Trump's approval rating jumped six points, one of his all-time highs while outgoing president Joe Biden's ratings dropped to a four-year low, according to a new poll. The Emerson College poll surveyed a hypothetical 2028 candidate with JD Vance topping with 30 per cent, followed by Florida Gov Ron DeSantis 5 per cent, Vivek Ramaswamy 3 per cent, Kennedy jr and Nikki Haley tied at 2 per cent.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump's approval rating jumped six points, one of his all-time highs while outgoing president Joe Biden's ratings dropped to a four-year low, according to a new poll. The Emerson College poll surveyed a hypothetical 2028 candidate with JD Vance topping with 30 per cent, followed by Florida Gov Ron DeSantis 5 per cent, Vivek Ramaswamy 3 per cent, Kennedy jr and Nikki Haley tied at 2 per cent.
